item.title: Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Reveal New October 2024 Seven-Star Tera Raid
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players can face Infernape in Seven-Star Tera Raids from Oct 3-6, with a second run from Oct 10-13.
  • Infernape will have the Rock-type Tera and bring its Hidden Ability, Iron Fist, boosting punching attacks by 50%.
  • Trainers must strategize to counter Infernape's powerful punches, Rock-type moves, and flurry of attacks.

Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players will have a new challenge in early October, as the fourth-generation starter Infernape will appear in Seven-Star Tera Raid dens. The arrival of Infernape as the next Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Tera Raid boss will come just a few days following the departure of Serperior the Unrivaled.

Known as the Flame Pokemon, Infernape first appeared in Pokemon Diamond and Pearl as the Sinnoh region's Fire-type Starter. Infernape is the fully-evolved form of Chimchar and Monferno, and is usually classified as a Fire and Fighting dual-type Pokemon. With a highly versatile move roster, and high speed, physical attack and special attack statistics, Infernape is one of the more popular starters to come from the Sinnoh region. However, the Flame Pokemon's intensity is offset by its low HP and defenses, and weaknesses to Water, Flying, and Ground attacks. In Pokemon Scarlet and Violet , Infernape can be obtained by catching a Chimchar in the Terarium's Polar Biome and evolving it.

Although Serperior the Unrivaled was a simpler Tera Raid battle, Pokemon Scarlet and Violet trainers will soon have a more challenging foe to face. According to Serebii.net, Infernape the Unrivaled will appear in Seven-Star Tera Raid dens starting Thursday, October 3, at 8:00 p.m. Eastern, and end on Sunday, October 6, at 7:59 p.m. Eastern. Pokemon trainers who miss out on the first fights against Infernape the Unrivaled will have another chance the following week, from October 10 to 13 at the same start and end times. Infernape the Unrivaled will have the Rock-type as its Tera type, and will grant the Mightiest Mark to Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players who defeat it.

Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Reveal Infernape Seven-Star Tera Raids (October 2024)

  • Pokemon Scarlet and Violet will host Infernape The Unrivaled in Seven-Star Tera Raids
  • The raids will run from October 3 to 6, with a second run on October 10 to 13.
  • Infernape the Unrivaled will be a Rock-Tera boss with the Iron Fist hidden ability.
  • Pokemon trainers will need to ensure their teams can withstand Infernape's powerful punches.

Similar to previous Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Tera Raid bosses, Infernape the Unrivaled will come with its Hidden Ability, Iron Fist, which will boost the potency of punching attacks by 50%. Ergo, moves such as Mach Punch, Fire Punch, and Thunder Punch are likely to appear in the Flame Pokemon's repertoire. In addition to its punches, Infernape the Unrivaled will use a Rock-type attack like Stone Edge or Rock Slide to take advantage of its Tera type, and may use moves like Taunt and Swords Dance to stymie its foes. Although Rock-type Pokemon are known for their sturdiness, Infernape's nature as a glass cannon leaves it vulnerable to Water, Ground, and Fighting attacks.

Pokemon with strong defenses of their own that can also use moves like Body Press may be crucial in the battle against Infernape the Unrivaled. What strategies Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players will develop remains to be seen.

item.title: Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom – Complete Guide & Walkthrough
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Getting Started – Tips & Tricks
    • Early-Game Guides, Tips, & Tricks
    • General Guides
  • Dungeon & Quest Walkthroughs
    • All Dungeon Guides
    • All Rift Guides
    • All Main Quest Guides
    • All Side Quest Guides
  • All Collectibles
    • Heart Piece Guides

The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom is the newest addition to the Zelda franchise, and the first to feature Zelda herself in the role of playable protagonist. Created by Nintendo and Grezzo , Echoes of Wisdom features the "classic" Zelda format, and is visually similar to Grezzo's previous entry into the franchise, the Link's Awakening remake . With Zelda front and center, Echoes of Wisdom makes several interesting changes to the formula, most notably to combat. However, at its core, this still remains a classic Zelda experience, one that bridges the gap between the "modern" and "classic" eras remarkably well.

Echoes of Wisdom features a massive map for players to explore, with all the classic regions fans of the series have come to expect (plus a few surprises). As Zelda makes her way through Hyrule, she is accompanied by Tri, her trusted partner. Tri's abilities serve as the foundation for nearly every major mechanic in Echoes of Wisdom , including combat and exploration. Zelda will use a huge system of Echoes (copies of items and enemies found in the world) to conquer her foes, traverse the world, and solve puzzles. Of course, Echoes of Wisdom also features countless dungeons to explore, items to collect, Heart Pieces to find, and secrets to reveal. All of it can be found through the guides and walkthroughs featured in this hub, which serves as a complete guide to The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom.

The Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom C omplete Guide & Walkthrough is a work in progress. We will be adding guides on a daily basis, so check back often for more content.

  • Getting Started – Tips & Tricks

    The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom features a huge amount of content, and certain aspects may be slightly overwhelming for new players. In this section, we will collect the guides that will help players get off to the best possible start. Whether its deciding which area to visit first , learning which Echoes are best for early-game combat and exploration, or covering important gameplay mechanics, our complete guide to Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom 's early-game will have you covered.

    • Early-Game Guides, Tips, & Tricks

      • Should You Go to Gerudo Desert or Jabul Waters First?
      • How to Upgrade Swordfighter Form (How to Get a Sword)
      • How to Summon More Echoes (Increase Tri Power)
      • How to Get a Horse (Early-Game)
      • How to Get Rupees Fast

    • General Guides

      • How to Use Amiibo
      • All Amiibo Rewards
      • How to Save Your Game
      • How to Unlock Fast Travel

  • Dungeon & Quest Walkthroughs

    It's no secret that classic dungeons are some of the most beloved aspects of the Zelda franchise, and The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom does not let fans down in this regard. This section will provide walkthroughs for each of Echoes of Wisdom's many dungeons . This will include both the legacy dungeons, and the special Stilled rifts that act as smaller dungeon areas. Along with the dungeons, the game features a large number of main quests , side quests , and sub-quests that form the main narrative. This section of the Echoes of Wisdom complete guide and walkthrough will feature all quest and dungeon content .

    • All Dungeon Guides

      • Suthorn Ruins Dungeon Walkthrough
      • Gerudo Sanctum Dungeon Walkthrough
      • Jabul Ruins Dungeon Walkthrough

    • All Rift Guides

      • Stilled Upper Zora River (Tri's Friends)
      • Stilled Desert Temple Ruins (Tri's Friends)
      • Stilled Suthorn Forest Guide

    • All Main Quest Guides

      • Prison Stealth Section (Escape Hyrule Castle)
      • "The Jabul Waters Rift" Quest Guide

    • All Side Quest Guides

      • A Curious Child Quest Guide
      • Questioning the Local Cats Quest Guide
      • A Treat for My Person Quest Guide
      • Recipes, Please! Quest Guide
      • The Flying Tile Quest Guide
      • Elusive Tumbleweeds Quest Guide
      • Tornado Ghost Quest Guide
      • Cuccos on the Loose Quest Guide

  • All Collectibles

    The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom features a huge number of collectibles for players to discover and collect. Spread around Hyrule, Zelda will find Heart Pieces , Might Crystals , Stamp Rally tables, and much more. Whether the effects are temporary, like the items needed for making Smoothies , or permanent, every collectible in Echoes of Wisdom is worth locating. This section of the Echoes of Wisdom complete guide and walkthrough will help players find all the game's collectibles.

    • Heart Piece Guides

      • Beach Cave Heart Piece Guide

item.title: 20 Best Anime To Watch If You Like Frieren: Beyond Journey’s End
item.description:
The newly released anime, Frieren: Beyond Journey’s End, has quickly captured the attention of many anime viewers. It tells the story of a hero party consisting of mage Frieren, hero Himmel, priest Heiter, and warrior Eisen, who, after a decade of fighting, finally defeat the demon king and return home before disbanding. But Frieren ages at a far slower pace and has to witness the aging and eventual passing of each of her companions.

On a journey with her new apprentice, Fern, Frieren visits places she had journeyed through with her former comrades. She is forced to reminisce on her past experiences and reflect on the essence of relationships when the opportunity to say goodbye has passed. For fans seeking anime with similar themes of adventure and reflection, here is a list of anime to watch if you like Frieren: Beyond Journey’s End .

Updated September 29, 2024, by Emedo Destiny: One of the highest-rated anime out in 2024, Frieren rightly deserves all of its hype and is loved by fans for many reasons. Reasons which range from an immaculate art style, more than thrilling action sequences, and an overpowered main character to properly curated character relationships. The series follows the life of the elven protagonist, Frieren, as she embarks on a journey that takes her back to a life she once lived in a not-so-faraway past. So, with the conclusion of its first season, some fans and viewers have been left to try and find anime projects similar to the series. Therefore, below is an updated list of the best anime similar for fans and viewers who love Frieren.

20 Grimgar: Ashes and Illusions

Anime-Planet Rating: 4.0 / 5

Grimgar: Ashes and Illusions presents the familiar Isekai trope of another world as a group of strangers find themselves in unfamiliar territory, in a foreign land with nothing else aside from their hazy memories and the distinct emotions running through every inch of their body: fear and survival.

The strangers, no more than teenagers, are given only the choice to become soldiers in the Reserve Army and have no other means of earning a living. While all the stronger candidates have set off in groups, those left behind must also find a way to survive. With their lives hanging by a thread, the remaining candidates form an unlikely group and together must ensure their survival.

19 The Faraway Paladin

Anime-Planet Rating: 3.8 / 5

The Faraway Paladin presents the new life of an unnamed man reincarnated into a new world after a previous life of isolation and stagnancy. Born as a baby boy named Will, he is raised by his three parents; a skeleton, a ghost, and a mummy. With all four living in the ruins of a city with no life, Will is taught many different things by his parents, but most importantly, Will is taught the meaning of love.

Like every other child, Will grows up learning of the world he is in as he prepares for the time when he must finally go and explore the world on his own, as it is required when every child comes of age. Per tradition, every adult must swear an oath to any god of their choice at the coming of age. As his departure draws closer, Will prepares for the truth behind his undead parents and, more importantly, the impact of the oath he is about to undertake.

18 Spice and Wolf

Anime-Planet Rating: 4.2 / 5

Spice and Wolf presents the tale of the wolf deity, Holo, and a traveling merchant, Kraft Lawrence, as their lives collide and snowball into something more than both had bargained for. The powerful wolf deity, Holo, was worshipped in the town of Pasloe for blessing the annual harvest. However, as the years go by and the people become more self-sufficient, Holo is reduced to nothing more than a special spectator in the town, more or less a folktale of what once was.

Holo’s days of spectating come to an end when she proposes to the traveling merchant Kraft, who happens to stop by, to become his business partner if he helps her go to her northern home, Yoitsu. Kraft recognizes her skills and agrees to fulfill her request, and the agreement kickstarts the beginning of their many adventures.

17 Fairies Albums

Anime-Planet Rating: 3.7 / 5

  • Where To Watch: Crunchyroll, Fairies Album
  • Release Years: 2020
  • Genre: Adventure, Fantasy, Mystery, Supernatural

Fairies Albums follows the life of a powerful spirit doctor widely famous in the spiritual world of the Yaogaui. While everyone knows of her prowess, very few know what she actually looks like. Traveling the world to help those in need of her services, she is accompanied by a young monk and a demon in the form of a man.

The series is similar to Frieren in that Freiren recounts her adventures on a journey that lets her relive them, while Fairies Album follows the various adventures of the spirit doctor in real-time, making it an even more thrilling experience.

16 The Ancient Magus Bride

Anime-Planet Rating: 4.2 / 5

The Ancient Magus Bride presents a touching perspective on the central character's life, Chise Hatori. Unlike Frieren, who recounts her adventures with her friends and comrades through a long life, Hatori recounts the ordeals that count as a life for her.

The story follows Chise, a 15-year-old Japanese girl who is sold at an auction to a mysterious man due to having no family and being deemed a social misfit. Fearful and unaware of her fate at the hands of her new master, Chise is taken to a study by the man, where he reveals himself to be Elias Ainsworth— a magus. What follows after the revelation leads into the tale of her life as the bride and apprentice of an ancient magus.

15 Good Night World

Anime-Planet Rating: 3.5 / 5

  • Where To Watch: Netflix
  • Release Years: 2023
  • Genre: Drama, Fantasy

Good Night World presents a tale where the separate realms of reality and augmented reality become enmeshed through the lives and actions of a particular family. The series is premised on the infamous online game called Planet. Atop the rankings of Planet is a powerful team of four players called the Akabane Family, whose members are a pseudo-family existent only in the game, or so they think.

Unknown to these four members, they are all members of a dysfunctional family in real life. The series focuses on the activities of the Akabane Family in the game of Planet. However, things take a dangerous twist as Planet's virtual and real worlds become entangled.

14 Blue Period

Anime-Planet Ratings: 4.0 / 5

  • Where To Watch: Netflix
  • Release Years: 2021
  • Genre: Drama

Blue Period presents a story marinated in the creativeness of art from the perspective of an impressionable young teenager whose love for the creative was at first sight. The story follows the life of a teenage high school second-year student, Yatora Yaguchi. Blessed with excellent grades and the perfect high school life, Yatora finds himself largely unmotivated and longing for a more intense calling in life.

While lost in thought about his situation, he finds himself in the school's art room, where he decides to alter the course of his life. Unable to use words to describe his feelings, he conveys them on the canvas. His sudden art piece earned him praise and ignited a passion for the arts. Yatora, however, will soon realise he will have to fight fiercely for his place in his newfound world.

13 Violet Evergarden

Anime-Planet Rating: 4.4 / 5

Violet Evergarden revolves around the central character, Violet, whose early life is spent as a weapon of the military owing to her unmatched combat prowess. Throughout her life, Violet is only ever cared for by one person, Major Gilbert, who named her and ensured she could speak and write. With the four-year-long war at an end and after being seriously injured and losing both arms, Violet is brought to the Evergarden household to recuperate.

With no one else to look to, She is left only with the words of the Major, much of whom she cannot understand. By chance, Violet witnesses the work of an Auto Memories Doll: a person who writes letters for others by conveying their true feelings in words. Violet quickly decides to train as an Auto Memories Doll, a decision that will lead to a journey of adventure, acceptance, and discovery.

12 Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation

Anime-Planet Rating: 4.2 / 5

Jobless Reincarnation follows the life of a middle-aged shut-in who has spent all his life being bullied, oppressed, and scorned. An act of heroism on his part soon becomes a tragic accident resulting in his death; however, the wheels of fate are still in motion, and he is reincarnated into a fantasy world as the child, Rudeus Greyrat of the Greyrats.

Granted another chance at life, Rudeus is determined to make the most of his new life and not leave anything to chance. With all the memories of his past life intact, Rudeus set out on an adventure of magical proportions to overcome the trauma of his past while growing as a magic swordsman.

11 To Your Eternity

Anime-Planet Rating: 4.3 / 5

To Your Eternity follows the unordinary journey of a supernatural and immortal being called It. Sent to Earth for no apparent reason and without emotions or identity, It can take the shape of those around it, animate or inanimate. First a sphere, then a rock, and then a wolf. It gains consciousness as an animal and begins a journey of varying proportions.

It meets a boy who lives alone in a ghost town and has been abandoned for a long time. Taken in by the boy, the duo decides to set out to find the paradise said to exist beyond the endless seas. However, their efforts amount to nothing and the boy can no longer proceed; neither is return possible. With death imminent, It takes on the form of the boy and thus begins a never-ending adventure in pursuit of new life and experiences.

10 In the Land of Leadale

Anime-Planet Rating: 3.7 / 5

In the Land of Leadale tells the story of Keina Kagami, a young girl on life support who can only find solace in a VRMMORPG called Leadale. When her life support fails, she wakes up to find that she has been permanently transported into Leadale two hundred years into the future as High Elf Cayna.

She seizes her second chance at life and creates new connections with the residents of the virtual game. This series is a lighthearted adventure story following the escapades of Cayna and her friends as they face exciting experiences and forge deeper bonds.

9 Tears to Tiara

Anime-Planet Rating: 3.5 / 5

  • Where To Watch: Prime Video
  • Release Years: 2009
  • Genre: Action, Fantasy, Adventure

This story unfolds when a small island known as Erin, inhabited by the Gael tribe, is confronted by the Holy Empire that has gradually conquered lands and risen to power. To protect themselves, the people of the island seek to resurrect the demon king Arawn by sacrificing a priestess called Riannon.

Although the plan goes sideways when Riannon’s brother, Arthur, saves her, Arawn is still released, appearing before the pair in human form with his identity hidden. This fantasy adventure follows the trio and other companions as they push back against the Empire and learn the dark secrets of the land along their journey.

8 Scrapped Princess

Anime-Planet Rating: 3.7 / 5

  • Where To Watch: Crunchyroll, Prime Video
  • Release Years: 2003
  • Genre: Action, Adventure, Drama, Fantasy, Sci-Fi

Scrapped Princess is an action-packed adventure that tells the story of a princess, Pacifica Casull, who is destined to destroy the world when she turns 16. When she is saved from an attempt on her life by a compassionate family, she leaves the village of Manhurin together with her adoptive brother and sister.

The news of her survival aggravates God Mauser’s followers and leaves Pacifica and her siblings in constant hiding from the church, the nobility, and commoners. This journey brings many revelations about the world and the true nature of the Scrapped Princess as her sixteenth birthday approaches.

7 Phantom Thief Jeanne

Anime-Planet Rating: 3.7 / 5

  • Where To Watch: -
  • Release Years: 1999-2000
  • Genre: Action, Drama, Romance, Supernatural

During the day, Kusakabe Maron is a sixteen-year-old high school student who hides her true identity as the reincarnation of Jeanne d' Arc. When it's nighttime, she transforms into Jeanne and, with the assistance of the angel, Fin Fish, seals demons in works of art .

Maron’s life is anything but easy. Her painful family background has left her deeply scarred, and she leans on her abilities to find a sense of self-worth. Maron's best friend, Miyako, is determined to capture Jeanne, and a new Phantom Thief called Sinbad arrives in town making Maron’s job even more difficult.

6 Wandering Witch: The Journey of Elaina

Anime-Planet Rating: 3.8 / 5

  • Where To Watch: Hulu, Crunchyroll, Prime Video
  • Release Years: 2020
  • Genre: Adventure, Fantasy

This heartwarming fantasy anime tells the story of a young witch named Elaina, who has always been drawn to stories of adventure. When she actualizes her desire to become a witch, she sets out on a journey across the world to experience an adventure of her own.

On her way, she meets a variety of people, picking up several stories and becoming a little part of each stranger’s story. Even though she encounters challenges, she doesn’t give up on her dream to expand her world.

5 Fairy Tail (2009)

Seventeen-year-old Lucy Heartfilia’s greatest desire is to become a full-fledged mage and join Fairy Tail, one of the most prestigious magical wizard guilds in the continent. This dream becomes a reality when she meets Natsu Dragneel, a member of Fairy Tail.

Lucy’s life takes off on a completely different path when she teams up with Natsu, Gray, and Erza, the guild's most unconventional wizards. Through their many adventures, the group forms a bond stronger than family. Amid their exposure to danger, one name remains a constant presence: Zeref, the dreaded wielder of dark magic.

4 The Story of Saiunkoku

Anime-Planet Rating: 4.0 / 5

  • Where To Watch: Prime Video
  • Release Years: 2006 - 2007
  • Genre: Adventure, Fantasy, Romance

Shuurei Kou is a member of a noble family that has fallen on hard times. Her life takes an unexpected turn when she accepts an offer of 500 pieces of gold to become the concubine of the new emperor and turn him into a good ruler.

Through her time in the palace, she revives her old dream of becoming a court official, but women are not allowed to be government officials. Although the Emperor has a reputation for preferring men, Shuurei has to fend off the Emperor's advances while facing the challenges of court life and politics.

3 Slayers Next

Anime-Planet Rating: 4.1 / 5

  • Where To Watch: Prime Video, Crunchyroll
  • Release Years: 1996
  • Genre: Adventure, Fantasy, Action, Comedy

When Lina Inverse and Gourry Gabriev unexpectedly meet their former partner, Zelgadis Graywords and Princess Ameilia, they join in on Zelgadis’ quest to find a treasured magical tome known as the Claire Bible. They hope to discover a way to recover Zelgadis’ human body from the secrets sheltered within the tome.

They meet a priest named Xellos, who offers assistance but only seems to get them into more trouble. Along the way, they find out that the Monster race has their own agenda, and Lina and her companions may play a significant role in their evil plans.

2 Cardcaptor Sakura

Anime-Planet Rating: 4.0 / 5

  • Where To Watch: Netflix, Crunchyroll, Prime Video
  • Release Years: 1998-2000
  • Genre: Adventure, Fantasy, Drama, Comedy, Romance

Sakura Kinomoto is just a ten-year-old fourth grader until she finds a mysterious book containing a set of cards. She accidentally scatters the cards all over the world and awakens the Beast of the Seal, Keroberos, who explains that she has released the mystical Clow Cards created by the sorcerer Clow Reed.

With the Cards set free, they pose a grave danger to the world, so Keroberos appoints Sakura as "the Cardcaptor" to find and recapture all the Cards. As she takes off on her magical adventures, Sakura must learn to balance her secret duty with the everyday challenges of a young girl.

1 Kino's Journey

Anime-Planet Rating: 4.1 / 5

  • Where To Watch: HIDIVE, Crunchyroll, Prime Video
  • Release Years: 2003
  • Genre: Adventure, Fantasy, Drama

This anime series follows the story of Kino, a young adventurer who rides a talking motorcycle named Hermes as they explore various places, spending only three days at each location. Just like Frieren , Kino's Journey captures a similar sense of the general feeling of adventuring from place to place with some reflections.

Kino and Hermes spend their time as observers, learning from the many people they meet. They make an intentional decision not to get involved in the world around them. They don’t try to change the places they explore, even if their values might appear absurd, because they believe that things are acceptable just as they exist.

item.title: 5 Best RPGs With An Elementalist Class
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • RPGs offer players the chance to wield elemental magic, dealing powerful damage in exchange for strategic drawbacks.
  • Select games, like Pillars of Eternity 2, Guild Wars 2, & Grim Dawn, provide diverse elemental classes with unique specializations.
  • Games like Guild Wars emphasize exploiting enemy weaknesses through elemental mastery & diverse skill combinations.

Fire, ice, air, and earth. The elements have been around in video games and tabletop roleplaying games almost as long as the mediums themselves, as the mystic manipulation of these primal forces is a strong magical fantasy. Granted, the fantasy is also bolstered by the fact that these magic users can typically deal the most damage in a game.

Of course, some of the best fantasy cRPGs have catered to this archetype and playstyle in their own ways. To land a spot on this list, each RPG has to offer the player a package of features (in other words, a class) that allows them to bend or bind the elements to their will, in whole or in part.

5 Pillars of Eternity 2: Deadfire - The Evoker Wizard

Honing In On Elemental Destruction

While wizards in Pillars of Eternity 2: Deadfire can master all the schools of magic, they are given the option to specialize in Evocation with the Evoker Wizard subclass. This buffs their elemental damage and gives them a chance to instantly cast a spell twice at the cost of not being able to cast spells from the schools of Conjuration and Transmutation.

It is generally better for a player to be as "wizened" as a wizard character before diving down the path of the elementalist Evoker Wizard subclass (as in knowing which spells fit in which skills), otherwise they may later encounter a spell they sorely wished they could use. However, those who can accept the drawback will have access to some of the most destructive spells in the game.

4 Guild Wars 2 - The Elementalist (Tempest, Weaver, Catalyst)

Using Primal Forces As A Pallet Of Pain

Unlike the original game, elementalists are truly masters of all elements, as they are expected to switch between fire, water, air, and earth to get the best out of their innate arcane potential. However, they do specialize in three of four elements through traits. Elementalists are known to deal the highest damage per second in exchange for having the lowest armor of all of Guild Wars 2's professions, but the idea is to take down large crowds with big, sweeping elemental attacks at range before anyone gets a hit in.

After hitting level 80 and gathering enough hero points, players with full expansions can try out one of the elementalist's elite specializations. The warhorn-warbling tempest commands the forces of nature with shouts and is able to squeeze extra juice out of the elements. Weavers combine elemental attacks together to create truly complex gameplay, and Catalysts are able to use the elements to summon primal forces to aid them in battle.

3 Grim Dawn - The Elementalist (Shaman + Demolitionist)

Roasting, Bursting, And Shatterering Otherworldly Enemies

Thanks to the undead pouring out of Hell and into Cairn, the elementalist (created by combining the shaman and demolitionist masteries) will have no shortage of targets for testing their powers over nature's most destructive facets. From the shaman side, the elementalist has access to powerful lightning-themed abilities.

The demolitionist is one part bullet-blasting gunslinger, part explosive expert, and lends the elementalist their pyromancy. All of Grim Dawn 's masteries have a heavy emphasis on combat, which means that an elementalist will not only have the power of storms and forest fires under their control but staggering strength and formidable firearms, as well, as they hack and slash through endless waves of enemies.

2 Guild Wars - The Elementalist

Drawing Chaos From A Deep Pool Of Elemental Potential

Just as every enemy in the game carries the same skills that players use, every enemy deals or is weak against one type of element or another. The elementalist wields four of the main types and, by dressing appropriately in the right element-resistant armor, is able to negate the damage of their chosen type. Figuring out which element to main between missions is part of the fun, as plenty of enemies will melt quickly when their weakness is exploited. The elementalist can take a secondary profession to complement their own suite of primal powers.

For example, the Mesmer's mantras allow them to absorb elemental damage entirely and turn it into energy for their spells for a short duration. A ranger's survival mastery skills will allow an elementalist to move faster while taking elemental damage. However, due to the huge energy cost associated with their skills, only an elementalist can reliably reign destruction on their enemies without running out, thanks to their primary attribute, Energy Storage.

1 Divinity: Original Sin 2 - The Enchanter & Wizard

Walking, Casting Natural Disasters

On the face of it, Divinity: Original Sin 2 's enchanter and wizard look to be two halves of a fairly typical destruction mage with all the usual access to elements. However, what makes these particular preset so alluring to fans of elemental carnage is Original Sin 2 's environmental effects mechanics, which allows players (magic users especially) to coat surfaces with blazing fire, soaking rain, deadly poison, and slippery ice, all of which have different effects in battle and combine with other spells in fascinating ways.

Water (hydrosophist) and lighting (aerotheurge) abilities are attached to the Enchanter preset, and fire (pyrokinetic) and earth (geomancy) abilities are attached to the wizard. Of course, Original Sin 2 's character creation and progression are fluid and considered build suggestions, so it is quite easy for a player to create a powerful mage to master all four elements.

item.title: Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom - The Fireworks Artist Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • The Fireworks Artist Walkthrough
  • The Fireworks Artist Reward

As you complete story quests in Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom , you'll unlock more side quests, so you should make a habit of returning to areas that you've saved from rifts. Some quests are even "connected" to each other, requiring you to complete one to complete another. One of these is "The Fireworks Artist" in Goron City. It's one of Echoes of Wisdom 's simpler side quests that won't take much of your time. Doing this quest will allow you to grab an Echo you won't be able to get anywhere else.

The Fireworks Artist Walkthrough

How to Complete

Before you can start "The Fireworks Artist," you need to get rid of the rift in Eldin Temple. Once this is done, return to Goron City, go up the stairs, and enter the room on the right from Darston's room . Speak to Basa to start the side quest. He's looking to make new types of fireworks, but he needs something called blastpowder soil . You can find blastpowder soil near the Rock-Roast Quarry entrance/waypoint . Blastpowder soil can be found near golden flowers . Look to the left of Rock-Roast Quarry , and you'll see a small hot spring near three patches of gold flowers. Inspect the sparkling area to get the blastpowder soil.

Blastpowder soil is a quest item and can't be used to make smoothies.

You can head northwest from Goron City to the Rock-Roast Quarry, but if you've been activating fast-travel spots, then just warp to it. It's highly likely you've unlocked the Waypoint stone during "The Rift on Eldin Volcano" main quest. If you're still not sure where it is, you can refer to the heart icon on the image below:

The Fireworks Artist Reward

How to Get Firework Echo

Once you've given Basa the blastpowder soil, you'll receive 50 Rupees as a reward. Before you leave, make sure you learn the Firework Echo . When used, this Echo unleashes fireworks, but won't have much use in fights or exploring. However, you'll need the Firework Echo for the "Explosions Galore!" side quest. Completing "Explosions Galore!" will unlock the Tocktorok Automation. This side quest can be picked up from Dampe's journal after you've completed "Automaton Engineer Dampe," which you get by speaking to Dampe after meeting him on the road to Lanayru.
